page.title: 14MY GRANDAD'S FARM
page.content: My name is Raymond Irvine and I live at Inverlochy Farm, just outside the 2 small blocks that we are doing for the Domesday Project. At the weekends however, I go over to work on my Grandad's Farm at Fordmouth. It is only a few lOO yards from Tomintoul School, down by the River Avon. Sometimes in the winter my Grandad and I have difficulty getting to the sheep to feed them. We feed the sheep some special feed called Draff and Barley mixed together which gives the sheep a lot of milk to feed the lambs over the winter. This keeps them strong. Sometimes when a cow is calving we take her into the barn but if we cannot manage to calf her we phone my Dad or the Vet. The Vet comes from Grantown-on-Spey. When the calves are big we sell them at Tomintoul Mart.
